profile.currencyDescription: The selected currency will be set as the primary one for displaying the total amount and for converting other currencies. Each transaction will still be saved in its original currency.

terms.subtitle:
mobile financial accounting application
[APPLICATION NAME] ("Application")
terms.previousVersions: Previous versions: archived at [URL_ARCHIVE] or available in the Appendix in the "Documents" section.
terms.intro1: These Terms of Use (hereinafter referred to as the "Terms") govern your access to and use of the App and related services, including paid features, integrations, import/export, push notifications, and cloud backups.
terms.intro3: Acceptance (electronic consent): You accept the Terms by doing one of the following: (a) clicking the "Agree/Continue" checkbox on the acceptance screen; and/or (b) registering an account; and/or (c) actually using the App after the Terms are displayed. We retain a technical record of acceptance (date/time/version/device or account ID) to confirm acceptance.
terms.intro4: If you do not agree to the Terms, do not use the App and delete it.
terms.defAccountDesc: — the User's account in the App.
terms.defUserContentDesc: — the data you enter/upload/import: transactions, categories, budgets, notes, files, as well as synchronization results when activating integrations.
terms.defIntegrationsDesc: — connectable synchronization channels with banks/payment services, both directly and through third-party aggregators.
terms.defSubscriptionDesc: — a paid model for accessing advanced functionality (e.g., premium analytics, extended limits, automation, additional backups, etc.).
terms.defAppStoresDesc: — distribution and billing platforms (e.g., App Store / Google Play).
terms.defPrivacyPolicyDesc: — a separate document describing the processing of personal and other data.
terms.services2: We may update functionality, change interfaces, and modify the availability of individual features, including releasing new versions of the App.
terms.registration2: Specific mechanisms depend on the App version and region.
terms.registration3: You agree to provide accurate information during registration and keep it up to date.
terms.registration4: You are responsible for maintaining the security of your access details and for all actions performed through your Account, unless otherwise provided by mandatory law.
terms.registration5: We reserve the right to apply security measures: login frequency limits, identity verification, and additional checks for suspicious activity.
terms.registration6: We may deny registration/service or restrict access for violations of the Terms, legal requirements, or abuse (see the "Termination/Blocking" section).
terms.userRights3: If the User enters/uploads third-party data (e.g., counterparties/payment details/comments), the User confirms that they have a legal basis for such input and is responsible for the legality of the content to the extent permitted by applicable law.
terms.operatorRightsTitle: Rights and obligations of the operator
terms.subscriptions1: The app may offer paid functionality through a subscription (auto-renewal) or a one-time payment. Specific plans, prices, currency, taxes, and trial terms are displayed prior to purchase.
terms.subscriptions2:
Payment channels:
24.1. Via app stores: Subscription purchases and management are made in the app store account.
24.2. Via an external payment provider (if applicable): Payment and refund terms may vary depending on the provider.
terms.subscriptions3:
Subscription cancellation:
25.1. Subscription cancellation on Google Play is done in the Google Play subscription settings; deleting the app does not cancel the subscription.
25.2. Subscription cancellation on Apple is done in the Apple subscription management.
terms.subscriptions4: Auto-renewal: If a subscription isn't canceled before the end of the current period, it may automatically renew for the next period under the terms of the app store or payment provider.
terms.subscriptions5: Subscription price changes: We may change the price or plan composition. Notice and acceptance procedures vary depending on the purchase channel (app store or direct billing) and the requirements of specific jurisdictions.
terms.returns1: App store purchases: Refunds and payment claim processing are governed by the relevant store's policies.
terms.returns2: Google indicates that refund policies vary depending on the product, time of purchase, payment method, and location.
terms.returns3: Purchases through an external payment provider (if applicable): Refund policies must be separately described and consistent with applicable consumer law.
terms.returns4: Access to the paid period is retained until the end of the paid period after cancellation, unless otherwise provided by the store's policies/law.
terms.ip1: The Application, its code, design, text, graphics, databases, trademarks, and other elements are owned by the Operator or are legally used by it.
terms.ip2: The Operator grants the User a limited, non-exclusive, non-transferable license to use the Application strictly for personal/professional accounting purposes within the limits of its functionality.
terms.ip3: The User retains rights to their User Content but grants the Operator the right to process this content to the extent necessary to provide the functionality (accounting, analytics, synchronization, export, backups), and in accordance with the Privacy Policy.
terms.privacyData1: The processing of personal and other data is carried out in accordance with the Privacy Policy: [POLICY_LINK].
terms.privacyData2: For users in the European Data Protection Board (EDP) and similar regimes, additional notices and rights may apply; for users in the Russian Federation, the requirements of Federal Law No. 152 and regulatory procedures apply; for users in other countries, applicable local regulations apply.
terms.privacyData3: If the App applies to operators required to notify data incidents under the Russian regulator's procedure, such procedures are described in the Privacy Policy and internal regulations.
terms.security1: We use reasonable security measures, including (where possible): encryption in transit, access control, and anomaly monitoring.
terms.security2: The application may support two-factor authentication (2FA). You agree to comply with these security measures and not share codes/tokens with third parties.
terms.security3: We do not guarantee absolute security, but we do commit to responding to known incidents and improving our security measures.
terms.integrationTitle: Integration with banks and payment services
terms.integration1: The application may provide synchronization functions with bank accounts/payment services when the User activates the integration.
terms.integration2:
Roles and responsibilities of the parties:
43.1. Depending on the integration model, a third-party aggregator/bank may act as (a) our processor, (b) an independent controller/operator, or (c) a joint controller.
43.2. We can only access the data you have authorized through the integration interface.
43.3. We are not a bank, payment institution, or party to your agreement with the bank, unless expressly stated otherwise.
terms.integration3: Accuracy and availability: Data from integrations depends on third parties. Delays, incompleteness, discrepancies, and temporary unavailability are possible. We do not guarantee the continuity and accuracy of data obtained through integrations and recommend verifying critical indicators with the primary source (the bank).
terms.integration4: Trust in credentials: You should not provide us with passwords for banking systems if the integration is enabled through secure token/permission mechanisms.
terms.importExport1: The App may allow you to import data (e.g., CSV/tables) and export reports.
terms.importExport2: You are responsible for the accuracy of the original imported data. We may perform normalization/enrichment of categories/formats, which may result in differences from the original file.
terms.importExport3: Exports are provided "as is," in the formats available in the App at the time of export.
terms.push1: The app can send push notifications: system (security/status), service (reminders), and (if enabled) marketing.
terms.push2: Push permissions are managed through the OS and/or App settings. Disabling push notifications may limit some functionality (e.g., security notifications).
terms.backup1: The app may offer cloud backup (either native or third-party) for recovery when changing devices or reinstalling.
terms.backup2: Backups may be stored for a limited time and purged on a cycle; when deleting an account, backup deletion may be delayed until the process cycle is complete.
terms.backup3: We do not guarantee recovery in every case (e.g., device damage, provider errors, or violation of terms of use).
terms.thirdParty1: The App may use third-party services for hosting, analytics, crash reporting, push delivery, anti-fraud, billing, and support.
terms.thirdParty2: Third-party services may have their own terms and policies. We recommend reviewing them if you use the relevant feature.
terms.disclaimerTitle: Disclaimer of warranties and limitation of liability
terms.disclaimer1: The Application is provided "as is" and "as available," to the extent permitted by applicable law.
terms.disclaimer2: We do not provide financial, investment, tax, or legal advice. Any reports/categorizations are for informational purposes only and are not a substitute for professional advice.
terms.disclaimer3: To the maximum extent permitted by law, the Operator is not liable for: consequential damages, lost profits, User decisions based on Application data, or failures/errors caused by third parties (banks, aggregators, app stores), unless otherwise provided by mandatory law.
terms.termination1: The User can stop using the App at any time and delete the App. If the subscription is purchased through an app store, deleting the app does not cancel the subscription; cancellation is completed in the app store account.
terms.termination2: The User can delete the Account if this feature is available.
terms.termination4: If possible, we will send a notice of blocking, stating the reason and available appeal methods, unless prohibited by law or creating additional security risks.
terms.changesTitle: Notifications of changes to terms and storage of versions
terms.changes1: We may change the Terms. The current version is published in the App and/or on the [URL_TOS] website.
terms.changes2: We maintain an archive of versions and can provide the effective date of each version.
terms.changes4: By continuing to use the App after the changes come into effect, you confirm your agreement to the new version. If you do not agree, please stop using it and cancel your subscription (if applicable).
terms.dispute1: Claims Procedure: Send a written claim to [LEGAL_EMAIL] or [ADDRESS] describing the dispute and your demands. Response time: [30] days.
terms.dispute2: If the dispute is not resolved, it will be handled in accordance with the procedure established in the "Applicable Law and Jurisdiction" section and the mandatory laws of your country of residence.
terms.law1: Basic Model (Default): The Terms are governed by the law of [OPERATOR COUNTRY], disputes are heard by the courts of [CITY/COUNTRY].
terms.law2:
Regional Disclaimers (Minimum Set):
70.1. For users in the United Kingdom and the European Union: Mandatory consumer protection rules may provide a right to bring a claim in the court of your place of residence.
70.2. For users in the United States of America (including California): Special consumer disclosure/privacy rules may apply.
70.3. For users in Brazil and India: Local digital services and data protection requirements apply.
70.4. For users in Canada: the provisions must take into account applicable consumer protection and privacy laws.
70.5. For users in the Russian Federation: mandatory Russian regulations, as well as notification/procedure requirements for personal data under Federal Law No. 152, apply.
terms.force1: The parties are released from liability for failure to fulfill obligations due to circumstances of force majeure if such circumstances are confirmed and are beyond the reasonable control of the party.

privacy.subtitle:
mobile financial accounting application
[APPLICATION NAME] ("Application")
privacy.intro1: This Privacy Policy (hereinafter referred to as the "Policy") describes how we collect, use, store, and protect your personal and other data when you use the Application.
privacy.intro2: The Policy is an integral part of the Terms of Use. By using the Application, you confirm that you have read and agree to this Policy.
privacy.intro3: We are committed to protecting your privacy and handling your data transparently, in compliance with applicable data protection legislation.
privacy.dataCollect1: Account data: information you provide during registration (name, phone number, email address, Telegram ID), as well as your profile settings and preferences.
privacy.dataCollect2: Financial data: transactions, categories, budgets, notes, and other financial records you create in the Application. This data is stored locally on your device and/or in cloud backups (if enabled).
privacy.dataCollect3: Technical data: device type and model, operating system version, Application version, unique device identifiers, IP address, language and regional settings, crash logs, and usage analytics.
privacy.dataCollect4: Integration data: if you enable integrations with banks or payment services, we may receive transaction data, account balances, and other financial information through these integrations, strictly within the scope you have authorized.
privacy.dataUse2: We do not use your financial data for advertising purposes or sell it to third parties.
privacy.dataSharing2: All third-party providers are bound by data processing agreements and are required to maintain appropriate security measures. We do not sell your personal data to any third party.
privacy.dataStorage1: Your financial data is primarily stored locally on your device. Cloud backups (if enabled) are stored on secure servers with encryption at rest and in transit.
privacy.dataStorage2: We implement reasonable security measures, including: data encryption (TLS for data in transit, AES for data at rest), access controls, regular security audits, and anomaly monitoring.
privacy.dataStorage3: While we strive to protect your data, no method of electronic storage or transmission is 100% secure. We cannot guarantee absolute security but commit to responding to any known security incidents promptly.
privacy.dataRetention1: We retain your data for as long as your account is active or as needed to provide the services. When you delete your account, we delete your personal data within [30] days, except where retention is required by law or for legitimate business purposes (e.g., fraud prevention, legal compliance).
privacy.dataRetention2: Cloud backups may be retained for a limited period after account deletion to complete the purge cycle. Anonymized and aggregated data may be retained for analytical purposes.
privacy.yourRights2: To exercise any of these rights, contact us at [PRIVACY_EMAIL]. We will respond within [30] days of receiving your request.
privacy.cookies1: The Application may use analytics tools to collect anonymized usage data (e.g., screen views, feature usage, crash reports). This data helps us improve the Application and user experience.
privacy.cookies2: You can opt out of analytics data collection through the Application settings (if available) or by adjusting your device privacy settings.
privacy.children1: The Application is not intended for children under the age of [16]. We do not knowingly collect personal data from children. If we discover that we have collected data from a child, we will take steps to delete it promptly.
privacy.transfers1: Your data may be transferred to and processed in countries other than your country of residence. In such cases, we ensure appropriate safeguards are in place (e.g., Standard Contractual Clauses, adequacy decisions) to protect your data in compliance with applicable data protection laws.
privacy.changesToPolicy1: We may update this Policy from time to time. The current version is published in the Application and/or on our website [URL_PRIVACY]. We will notify you of material changes at least [15] days before they take effect.
privacy.changesToPolicy2: Your continued use of the Application after the updated Policy takes effect constitutes your acceptance of the changes.
